intro: Maximilianea tetrapora, commonly known as the four-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its milky sap is a distinguishing feature, often exuding when the stems are broken. Maximilianea tetrapora is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
